issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: There's an ordering issue with the LLAP queue that we've seen on some run.

comments.body: [~sseth] can you take a look?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12873326 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

nit: In sanitizer, when you detect/log error can you print the entire queue in INFO mode for debugging? You can do this before commit.
+1 otherwise

Added queue logging; removed the automatic fixing of the queue. We know what has caused the current bug; if there are more bugs we probably want to know about them and not have this automatically readjust queue, making queries slower between readjustments

ATTACHMENT ID: 12873343 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Mostly looks good. Couple of small changes before committing.
- Would be good to completely remove EvictingPriotiyBlockingQueue.reinsertIfExistsUnsafe - is no longer user except in tests.
- The synchronized block in getExecutorsStatus. What happens if this is removed? (The UI being able to affect scheduling is not great)

Updated the patch. The sync block is how the queue access is synchronized. The queue itself is synchronized too, though, so it shouldn't be necessary. Overall, some synchronization is needed if we want to get the queue in order. To protect against malicious users, rate limiting should happen on UI level.
Committed to branches; thanks for the review.
